gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤਨ ਕੈ ਮਹਾਂ ਰਸ ਹੋਮੀਅੈ ਤਿਹ ਮਾਹਿ ||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaantan Kai Mahaan Ras Homeeai Tih Maah(i)||
translation: Various kids of tasteful foods were burnt in the alftar.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖ ਚਕ੍ਰਤ ਰਹੈ ਦਿਜੰਬਰ ਰੀਝਹੀ ਨਰਨਾਹਿ ||੫||੧੪੬||
translation: Seeing which the superb Brahmins were astonished and the kings pleased.5.146.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਅਨੇਕ ਬਿੰਜਨ ਹੋਮੀਅੈ ਤਿਹ ਅਾਨ ||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Anek Binjan Homeeai Tih Aan||
translation: Many and various types of foods were burnt in the altar.

gurmukhi: ਚਤੁਰ ਬੇਦ ਪੜੈ ਚਤ੍ਰ ਸਭ ਬਿੱਪ ਬਯਾਸ ਸਮਾਨ ||
transliteration: Chatur Bed Padai Chatra Sabh Bipp Beyaas Samaan||
translation: On all the four sides the learned Brahmins were reciting the four Vedas, like Vyas.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਅਨੇਕ ਭੂਪਤ ਦੇਤ ਦਾਨ ਅਨੰਤ ||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Anek Bhoopat Det Daan Anant||
translation: Many kings were giving innumerable types of gifts in charity.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਮ ਭੂਰ ੳੁਠੀ ਜਯਤ ਧੁਨਿ ਜੱਤ੍ਰ ਤੱਤ੍ਰ ਦੁਰੰਤ ||੬||੧੪੭||
transliteration: Bhoom Bhoor Outhijayat Dhoun(i) Jattra Tattra Durant||6||147||
translation: Here, there and everywhere on the earth infinite strain of victory was sounded.6.147.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਤ ਜੀਤ ਮਵਾਸ ਅਾਸਨ ਅਰਬ ਖਰਬ ਛਿਨਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Jeet Jit Mavaas Aasan Arab Kharab Chhinaae||
translation: Counquering the rebel kings and seizing the unaccountable wealth and precious things;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨਿ ਅਾਨਿ ਦੀੲੇ ਦਿਜਾਨਨ ਜੱਗ ਮੈ ਕੁਰਰਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Aan(i) Aan(i) Deee Dijaanan Jagg Mai Kur-raae||
translation: (Yusdhishtra) the king of Kuru country brought that wealth and distributed among the Brahmins.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਅਨੇਕ ਧੂਪ ਸੁ ਧੂਪੀਅੈ ਤਿਹ ਅਾਨ ||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Anek Dhoop Su Dhoopeeai Tih Aan||
translation: Many types of fragrant materials were ignited there.

gurmukhi: ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ੳੁਠੀ ਜਯੰ ਧੂਨਿ ਜੱਤ੍ਰ ਤੱਤ੍ਰ ਦਿਸਾਨ ||੭||੧੪੮||
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Outhijayan Dhoun(i) Jattra Tattra Disaan||7||148||
translation: Here, there and everywhere in all directions many types of the strains of victory were sounded.7.148.

gurmukhi: ਜਰਾਸਿੰਧਹ ਮਾਰ ਕੈ ਪੁਨਿ ਕੈਰਵਾ ਹਥਿ ਪਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Jaraasindhah Maar Kai Poun(i) Kairvaa Hath(i) Paae||
translation: After slaying Jarasandh and then conquering the Kauravas,

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਸੂੲਿ ਕੀਓ ਬਡੋ ਮਖ ਕਿਸਨ ਕੇ ਮਤਿ ਭਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Raajsooe Keeo Bado Makh Kisan Ke Mat(i) Bhaae||
translation: Yudhishtra performed the great Rajsu sacrifice in consultation with Krishna.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਸੂੲਿ ਸੁ ਕੈ ਕਿਤੈ ਦਿਨ ਜੀਤ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਨੰਤ ||
transliteration: Raajsooe Su Kai Kitai Din Jeet Satra Anant||
translation: Conquering innumerable enemies, for many days, he performed the Rajsu sacrifice.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜਮੇਧ ਅਰੰਭ ਕੀਨੋ ਬੇਦ ਬਯਾਸ ਮਤੰਤ ||੮||੧੪੯||
transliteration: Baajmedh Aranbh Keeno Bed Byaas Matant||8||149||
translation: Then, with the advice of Ved Vyas, he began the performance of horse-sacrifice.8.149.
